      • processQueryInput

        public void processQueryInput(java.lang.String userInput)
        The processQueryInput function is called by the View when the user enters a word, row, column and orientation. The function checks if it is currently the user's turn to play. If so, it sets up an array of strings that contains each character in the word entered by the user. It then iterates through this array and checks if each character exists in any of our tiles on hand (the ones displayed on screen). If all characters exist in our tiles on hand, we set up a new string with these characters removed from their original positions (so they can't be used again) and pass this string to gameModel
        Parameters:
        userInput - Get the user's input from the view

      • processChallengeInput

        public void processChallengeInput(java.lang.String userInput)
        The processChallengeInput function is called when the user has been challenged by another player. The function takes in a String as input, which represents the user's response to the challenge. If the user responds with "yes", then we set their challenge input to "C". Otherwise, we set it to "xxx".
        Parameters:
        userInput - Get the user's input from the gui

      • updateTilesFromModel

        public void updateTilesFromModel(java.util.List<java.lang.String> updatedTiles)
        The updateTilesFromModel function is called by the model when it has been updated. It takes a list of strings as an argument, and updates the tilesProperty list with these values.
        Parameters:
        updatedTiles - Update the tilesproperty list
